newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire rebel chief appeals for pressure on Mobutu.
newsitem.headline: Zaire rebel chief appeals for pressure on Mobutu.

text.p: Zaire rebel leader Laurent Kabila appealed on Wednesday to the international community to force President Mobutu Sese Seko to attend talks at sea to avoid a battle for Kinshasa.

Kabila, head of the Alliance of Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Congo-Zaire (ADFL), told Reuters he would not go to Gabon, a venue preferred by Mobutu and encouraged by the United States, for security reasons.
"We remain committed to the talks despite our military advantage but the international community must now put pressure on Mobutu and force him to come to talks at sea," Kabila said.
"Only talks will avoid a battle for Kinshasa. But if Mobutu cannot come to talks then it is business as usual for us. It means we will have to take Kinshasa," he added.
Kabila said he had totally rejected Mobutu's preferred venue, Gabon, for security reasons.
Although a U.S. diplomat said on Tuesday Mobutu had refused talks on a South African ship, Mobutu's son and spokesman Nzanga Mobutu declined on Wednesday to rule out talks off the coast of Zaire.
